thread.title: Internal Error

author: A N N A (@annina_c86) on Sep 4, 2016 at 11:46am PDT Trump won’t be alone in the town’s infamous park. The eclectic array of marble-work in the park already features a sculpture of a French police dog killed in a raid after the Paris terror attacks, and two relating to the 2012 Costa Concordia cruise ship disaster. One statue is of the ship's fleeing captain, Francesco Schettino, who is depicted with rabbit ears, while another honors coastguard Captain Gregorio De Falco, who famously told the cowardly captain to get back on board the doomed ship. Last year, the town commissioned a statue of David Bowie shortly after his death. The project, which was funded by private businesses for just under $70,000, was recently completed and is set to be put in the park any day. Advertisement
title: Internal Error
text:
Email Print President Donald Trump sits at his desk on Air Force One upon his arrival at Andrews Air Force Base, Md., Thursday, Jan. 26, 2017. (AP Photo/Pablo Martinez Monsivais) (Copyright 2017 The Associated Press. All rights reserved.)
Abraham Lincoln was dead 57 years before the Lincoln Memorial was constructed. George Washington had to wait 89 years after his death before his monument in Washington, DC, was finished. Thomas Jefferson had it the worst, as his memorial didn’t get built until 117 years after he passed away.
Donald Trump has been in office less than three weeks and already plans are being drawn up for a statue to memorialize the United States’ 45 th president. But there is one catch.
More on this... Ex-CIA officer facing Italy prison term calls on Trump to 'stop this precedent'
